title: 1 dead, 11 injured in block party shooting on Detroit's west side
content:
Detroit Police are investigating a shooting that has killed one person and left at least 11 others injured.
Detroit Police Assistant Chief Steve Dolunt told Fox 2 Saturday night that the shooting happened at a children's birthday party during a block party. The circumstances surrounding the shooting are unknown.
The shooting, which allegedly occurred on a basketball court near the intersection of Dexter and Tuxedo on Detroit's west side, happened shortly before 9 p.m.
Dolunt said about 400 people were at the party and, at this point, no witnesses are talking or cooperating with police. No children were injured in the shooting.
According to police, a 21-year-old man was killed.
Detroit Police are asking if you saw or heard anything to call Crime Stoppers at 1-800-SPEAK UP.
1 dead, 11 injured in block party shooting on Detroit's west side
